member.name: M:Google.Protobuf.Reflection.FileDescriptorSet.ApplyFileDependencyOrder
member.summary: Reorders the so that they are in dependency order, i.e. dependencies come FIRST
member.remarks: This is mostly useful for compatibility with protoc with the --descriptor_set_out --include_imports switches

member.name: T:Google.Protobuf.Reflection.DescriptorProto
member.summary: Describes a message type.

member.name: T:Google.Protobuf.Reflection.DescriptorProto.ReservedRange
member.summary: Range of reserved tag numbers. Reserved tag numbers may not be used by fields or extension ranges in the same message. Reserved ranges may not overlap.

member.summary: Gets the extension data associated with an object, as a byte-array
member.remarks: This is required for equivalence tests vs 'protoc'

member.remarks: This is required for equivalence tests vs 'protoc'

member.name: T:Google.Protobuf.Reflection.OneofDescriptorProto
member.summary: Describes a oneof.

member.name: T:Google.Protobuf.Reflection.EnumDescriptorProto
member.summary: Describes an enum type.

member.name: T:Google.Protobuf.Reflection.EnumDescriptorProto.EnumReservedRange
member.summary:
Range of reserved numeric values. Reserved values may not be used by entries in the same enum. Reserved ranges may not overlap.
Note that this is distinct from DescriptorProto.ReservedRange in that it is inclusive such that it can appropriately represent the entire int32 domain.

member.name: T:Google.Protobuf.Reflection.UninterpretedOption
member.summary: A message representing a option the parser does not recognize. This only appears in options protos created by the compiler::Parser class. DescriptorPool resolves these when building Descriptor objects. Therefore, options protos in descriptor objects (e.g. returned by Descriptor::options(), or produced by Descriptor::CopyTo()) will never have UninterpretedOptions in them.

member.name: T:Google.Protobuf.Reflection.UninterpretedOption.NamePart
member.summary: The name of the uninterpreted option. Each string represents a segment in a dot-separated name. is_extension is true iff a segment represents an extension (denoted with parentheses in options specs in .proto files). E.g.,{ ["foo", false], ["bar.baz", true], ["qux", false] } represents "foo.(bar.baz).qux".

member.name: T:Google.Protobuf.Reflection.IFileSystem
member.summary: Represents a virtual file system

member.summary: Indicates whether a specified file exists

member.name: M:Google.Protobuf.Reflection.IFileSystem.OpenText(System.String)
member.summary: Opens the specified file for text parsing
